{"body":"<p>I saved a json file in google cloud storage, I want to fetch the file, read the json content and save the content to client indexeddb.</p>\n<pre><code>loadJSON(function(json) {\n   console.log(json); // this will log out the json object\n });\n\nvar fileUrl =&quot;https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/rwrwr-rwr.appspot.com/o/TestCatalog.json?alt=media&amp;token=r545-54-54-54-45455&quot;\n\n\nfunction loadJSON() {\n\n  var request = new Request(fileUrl);\n\n  fetch(request, {mode: 'cors'}).then(function(response) {\n    // Convert to JSON\n    return response.json();\n   }).then(function(j) {\n  // Yay, `j` is a JavaScript object\n   console.log(JSON.stringify(j));\n  }).catch(function(error) {\n   console.log('Request failed', error)\n  });\n  }\n</code></pre>\n<p>The fetch is producing this error</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>from origin 'null' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. {"body":"<p>Let me first start off by saying: yes, I do understand why we can't immediately deprecate <code>var</code> in JavaScript. Something with billions of lines of archaic code.</p>\n<p>The problem is, by not doing anything at all, in 20 years time we still would allow <code>var</code> in JavaScript. And people would still run into the same old problems we face now with this contraption.</p>\n<p>To solve this, can't we add a directive such as <code>&quot;use strict&quot;;</code> that indicates that no <code>var</code> should be used in the underlying code? At least we will slowly migrate towards a <code>var</code> free world :)</p>\n<p>And similarly, the amazingly confusing <code>==</code> operator (which I personally almost never use because of its side effects) could operate like a <code>===</code> operator, through a directive. Something like a <code>&quot;use strict equality&quot;</code> directive.</p>\n<p>This way in a decade or so, at least a large portion of JavaScript code will be proper.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":440,"question_id":64973644,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Tag Manager injects them all at the bottom of the DOM and <strong>they are never removed</strong>. If a user views many products, he will end up with hundreds of scripts tags and iFrames in the DOM. This seems to be causing serious memory leaks.</p>\n<p>How can I prevent this? Is there something I don't understand using GTM in SPAs? I've searched but haven't found much information. Either people don't care about memory leaks or I'm doing something wrong.</p>\n<p>Is there a way to clear all old script tags and iFrames so the garbage collector can do its job and free up some memory?</p>\n<p>Thanks for your help, hopefully this thread can help more people facing the same problem as SPAs are getting more popular.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":432,"question_id":64973804,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>The tracking number input has a fixed format: ab-cdefg-h. The first character (a) must be a digit in between 1 and 9 (inclusive). The second character (b) is an English character in uppercase. Next is a hyphen (-). The fourth character (c) is an English character in uppercase. It is then followed by four even-numbered digits (i.e., d, e, f, g can be 0, 2, 4, 6 and 8 only). Next is a hyphen. The last character (h) is a number representing the month, hence “h” can be 1 to 12. If the format is not correct, the text “This field is not valid” will be shown next to the text box as in Figure partb_3.</p>\n<p><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/wy9YN.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></p>\n<p><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/1AS7k.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":445,"question_id":64973550,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>this builds on my previous question (<a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64968899/filter-data-with-javascript-callback-in-pythons-bokeh\">Filter data with Javascript callback in Python&#39;s Bokeh</a>) that was successfully answered and takes it one step further.</p>\n<p>When I try to filter my plot with multiple filters in Python's Bokeh, the function returns an empty plot.</p>\n<p>I can't find any conceptual differences to the working solution with one filter so would appreciate any hint.</p>\n<p>Below is a reproducible example:</p>\n<pre><code># Packages\nimport bokeh.events as bev\nimport bokeh.layouts as bla\nimport bokeh.models as bmo\nimport numpy as np\nimport pandas as pd\nfrom bokeh.plotting import figure, output_file, show\n\n# Data\ndata = pd.DataFrame(\n    data=np.array(\n        [\n            [1, 1, 'a', 'c', 0.5],\n            [2, 2, 'a', 'c', 0.5],\n            [3, 3, 'a', 'd', 0.75],\n            [4, 4, 'b', 'd', 1],\n            [5, 5, 'b', 'd', 2]\n        ]\n    ),\n    columns=['x', 'y', 'category 1', 'category 2', 'other information']\n)\n\n# Setup\noutput_file('dashboard.html')\n\nsource = bmo.ColumnDataSource(data)\n\n# Define dropdown options\ndropdown_options1 = [\n                       ('All', 'All'), None\n                   ] + [(cat, cat)\n                       for i, cat in enumerate(sorted(data['category 1'].unique()), 2)\n                   ]\ndropdown_options2 = [\n                       ('All', 'All'), None\n                   ] + [(cat, cat)\n                       for i, cat in enumerate(sorted(data['category 2'].unique()), 2)\n                   ]\n\n# Generate dropdown widget\ndropdown1 = bmo.Dropdown(label='Category1', button_type='default', menu=dropdown_options1)\ndropdown2 = bmo.Dropdown(label='Category2', button_type='default', menu=dropdown_options2)\n\nfiltered_data = bmo.ColumnDataSource(data)\n# Callback\ncallback = bmo.CustomJS(\n    args = dict(unfiltered_data = source, filtered_data = filtered_data, dropdown1 = dropdown1 , dropdown2 = dropdown2 ),\n    code = &quot;&quot;&quot;\n\nvar data = unfiltered_data.data;\nvar ind = dropdown1.item;\nvar ctr = dropdown2.item;\n\nfunction generateNewDataObject(oldDataObject){\n    \n    var newDataObject = {}\n    \n    for (var key of Object.keys(oldDataObject)){\n            \n        newDataObject[key] = [];\n        \n    }\n    \n    return newDataObject\n\n}\n\n\nfunction addRowToAccumulator(accumulator, dataObject, index) {\n    \n    for (var key of Object.keys(dataObject)){\n            \n        accumulator[key][index] = dataObject[key][index];\n        \n    }\n    \n    return accumulator;\n}\n\n\nif (ind === 'All' &amp;&amp; ctr === 'All'){\n                \n    data = unfiltered_data.data;\n                \n} else if (ctr === 'All') {\n            \n    var new_data =  generateNewDataObject(data);\n    \n    for (var i = 0; i &lt;= unfiltered_data.data['category 1'].length; i++){\n            \n        if (unfiltered_data.data['category 1'][i] == ind) {\n                \n            new_data = addRowToAccumulator(new_data, unfiltered_data.data, i);\n            \n        }\n    }\n    \n    data = new_data;\n    \n} else if (ind === 'All'){\n    \n    var new_data =  generateNewDataObject(data);\n    \n    for (var i = 0; i &lt;= unfiltered_data.data['category 2'].length; i++){\n            \n        if (unfiltered_data.data['category 2'][i] == ctr) {\n unfiltered_data.data['category 1'][i] == ind) {\n                \n            new_data = addRowToAccumulator(new_data, unfiltered_data.data, i);\n            \n        }\n    }\n    \n    data = new_data;            \n                        \n}\n\nfiltered_data.data = data;\nfiltered_data.change.emit();\n&quot;&quot;&quot;\n)\n\n\n# Link actions\ndropdown1.js_on_event(bev.MenuItemClick, callback)\ndropdown2.js_on_event(bev.MenuItemClick, callback)\n\n# Plot\np1 = figure(plot_width=800, plot_height=530, title=None)\n\np1.scatter(x='x', y='y', {"body":"<p>I would like to link two divs (left edge of <code>a2</code> and left edge of <code>b1</code>) with line. So whe user scrolls the <code>container</code> - the line does not scroll and stay on the same place.</p>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>My code is:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n        &lt;script src=&quot;https://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.12.4.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n        &lt;script src=&quot;https://code.jquery.com/ui/1.12.1/jquery-ui.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;div id=&quot;customHeader&quot;&gt;custom header&lt;/div&gt;\n\n        &lt;div id=&quot;container&quot;&gt; \n            &lt;div id=&quot;firstRow&quot;&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementA&quot;&gt;a1&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementA&quot;&gt;a2&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div id=&quot;fromElement&quot; class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b2&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b3&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b4&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b5&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b6&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b7&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b8&lt;/div&gt;\n                &lt;div class=&quot;elementB&quot;&gt;b9&lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;      \n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;svg id=&quot;mySvg&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;/svg&gt; \n    &lt;/body&gt;\n    \n    &lt;script&gt;\n        $(function(){\n            linkElements();\n        });\n        \n        function linkElements(){\n            var fromHeight = $(&quot;#fromElement&quot;).position().top - $(&quot;#fromElement&quot;).height()/2;\n            var fromLeft = $(&quot;#fromElement&quot;).position().left;\n            var toHeight = $(&quot;#toElement&quot;).position().top - $(&quot;#toElement&quot;).height()/2;\n            var toLeft = $(&quot;#toElement&quot;).position().left;\n            var middleVertical = toHeight - fromHeight;\n            var middleHorizontal = toLeft - fromLeft;\n            var elementToAppend = &quot;&lt;path d='M &quot; {"body":"<p>I want to update existing data information using update data form. The input should populate the existing values. How to do that?</p>\n<p>As of now, I have to enter all the fields manually to update the form.</p>\n<p>Update doctor .ts file</p>\n<pre><code>import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core';\nimport { FormArray, FormBuilder, FormControl, FormGroup } from '@angular/forms';\nimport { ActivatedRoute, Router } from '@angular/router';\nimport { Doctor } from '../doctor';\nimport { DoctorService } from '../doctor.service';\n\n\n@Component({\n  selector: 'app-update-doctor',\n  templateUrl: './update-doctor.component.html',\n  styleUrls: ['./update-doctor.component.css']\n})\nexport class UpdateDoctorComponent implements OnInit {\n\n\n\n  id:any;\n  doctor:Doctor;\n  updateForm:FormGroup;\n\n  constructor(private route: ActivatedRoute, private router: Router,private doctorservice: DoctorService,private formbuilder:FormBuilder) {\n\n   }\n\n  ngOnInit() {\n     this.doctor = new Doctor();\n  }\n\n  updateDoctor(){\n    this.doctorservice.updateDoctor( this.doctor)\n    .subscribe(data =&gt;{\n      console.log(data);\n      this.doctor = new Doctor();\n      \n      window.location.reload();\n\n    })\n    this.gotoList();\n  }\n\n\n\n  onSubmit(){\n    this.updateDoctor();\n  }\n\n\n\n  gotoList() {\n    this.router.navigate(['doctor']);\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>update doctor .html file</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;card col-md-4 offset-md-4 mt-3&quot; Id&lt;/label&gt;\n      &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; class=&quot;form-control&quot; id=&quot;doctorId&quot; required [(ngModel)]=&quot;doctor.doctorId&quot;  name=&quot;doctorId&quot; #doctorId&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;form-group&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;label for=&quot;doctorName&quot;&gt; {"body":"<p>I have a problem with tinyMCE default text fotmatting features. So lets say I would like to change text color, this is a html paragraph of my text that I would like to edit:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;p class=&quot;normal-paragraph-0001&quot; dir=&quot;ltr&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;AAAA&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;&lt;sup&gt;bb&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt; CCCC&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;DDDD&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/p&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>After selecting that paragraph and applying new font color (which is performed with <code>ExecCommand('ForeColor', false, color);</code>) html looks like:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;p class=&quot;normal-paragraph-0001&quot; dir=&quot;ltr&quot;&gt;\n&lt;span style=&quot;color: rgb(208, 2, 27);&quot; data-mce-style=&quot;color: #d0021b;&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;AAAA&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;&lt;sup&gt;bb&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt; CCCC&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;DDDD&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/p&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>So all it basicly does, is packing selected tags in another span tag with selected style(font color). The problem is that newly applied style is overrided by &quot;old&quot; css classes which are still present in inner span tags.\nI would like to ask you guys: Is it possible to change that behavoiur directly in tinyMCE (I have tried to find it in docs, but most of the features are poorly described and the truth is that I am pretty begginer to html and frontend stuff) or I need to peek every tag manually and change its style in code?</p>\n<p>*By changing that behavoiur I mean, f.ex. is it possible to tell tinyMCE to change the style attribute of every selected tag separately?</p>\n<p>EDIT:\nOk, I have found that there is a <a href=\"https://www.tiny.cloud/docs-3x/reference/configuration/Configuration3x@formats/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">selector option</a> for formats:</p>\n<pre><code>forecolor : {inline : 'span', selector : 'span', styles : {color : '%value'}},\n</code></pre>\n<p>so basickly it works fine in above example - it adds style attribute with color property:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;p class=&quot;normal-paragraph-0001&quot; dir=&quot;ltr&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; style=&quot;color: rgb(144, 19, 254);&quot; data-mce-style=&quot;color: #9013fe;&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;AAAA&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; style=&quot;color: rgb(144, 19, 254);&quot; data-mce-style=&quot;color: #9013fe;&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;&lt;sup&gt;bb&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; style=&quot;color: rgb(144, 19, 254);&quot; data-mce-style=&quot;color: #9013fe;&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt; CCCC&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;default-paragraph-font-001&quot; style=&quot;color: rgb(144, 19, 254);&quot; data-mce-style=&quot;color: #9013fe;&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;DDDD&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/p&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>But to be truth it does not feel like a right solution and it does not work in situation when there is a span tag in other span tag, f.ex.:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;p class=&quot;pt-Normalny-000128&quot; dir=&quot;ltr&quot;&gt;\n&lt;span&gt;\n    &lt;span class=&quot;pt-Domylnaczcionkaakapitu-000042&quot; lang=&quot;en-GB&quot;&gt;On the 2&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/span&gt;\n&lt;/p&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>it will style only outer span, but no inner one.\nI guess this situation (span in a span) is not syntaxly correct, is it? But if it will happen, is it a better way to do formatting in tinyMCE other than using selector combined with inline:'span' property?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":477,"question_id":64972809,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

:key=&quot;entry&quot; lang=&quot;lang-markup&quot; :title=&quot;entry.title&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;template v-slot:content&gt;\n      &lt;div v-html=&quot;entry.content&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;/template&gt;\n    &lt;template v-slot:examples&gt;\n      &lt;div v-html=&quot;entry.examples&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/template&gt;\n    &lt;template v-slot:code&gt;\n        {{entry.code}}\n    &lt;/template&gt;\n  &lt;/base-section&gt;\n&lt;/template&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\nexport default {\n  mounted(){\n    this.$nextTick(function () {\n    Prism.highlightAll();\n    this.getData()\n  })\n  },\n    \n  updated(){\n    this.$nextTick(function () {\n    Prism.highlightAll();\n    this.getData()\n  })\n  },\n  methods:{\n    getData(){\n      const url= 'https://example.dev/api/collections/get/'+this.$route.name+'?token=XXXXXXXXX'\n    \n    fetch(url)\n    .then(collection =&gt; collection.json())\n    .then(collection =&gt; {\n\n      const entries = [];\n\n            for (const id in collection.entries) {\n              entries.push({\n                title: collection.entries[id].Title,\n                content: collection.entries[id].Content,\n                examples: collection.entries[id].Examples,\n                code: collection.entries[id].Code,\n\n              });\n            }\n\n            this.entries = entries;\n\n    });\n    }\n  },\n  data() {\n    return {\n      entries:[]\n    };\n  },\n};\n&lt;/script&gt;\n\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>THE PROBLEM:</strong>\nThis solution works. {"body":"<p>I am trying to do a scoreboard for my quiz command, in a way that the person runs the command !quiz, and answers the question. If the question is answered correctly, in a specific file named Storage she gets one extra point, in so making a scoreboard for the amount of answers the has gotten correctly. I have watched a youtube tutorial (<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dYpaV_pzGTA&amp;t=271s\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dYpaV_pzGTA&amp;t=271s</a>) for the Scoreboard file, but the author's id keeps being determined as <code>undefined</code>, not allowing me to store all of the points.</p>\n<p>For reference, here is my code</p>\n<pre><code>//Base...\nconst Discord = require('discord.js');\nconst client = new Discord.Client();\n\n//Quiz event...\nclient.on('message', message =&gt; {\n\n    if (!message.content.startsWith(prefix) || message.author.bot) return;\n    if (message.channel instanceof Discord.DMChannel) return message.channel.send('Aqui não podem ser executado comandos!')\n        .then(msg =&gt; {\n            msg.delete({ timeout: 5000 })\n        })\n    const quiz = require('./quiz.json');\n    const item = quiz[Math.floor(Math.random() * quiz.length)];\n\n    const args = message.content.slice(prefix.length).trim().split(/ +/);\n    const command = args.shift().toLowerCase();\n\n    const filter = response =&gt; {\n        return item.answers.some(answer =&gt; answer.toLowerCase() === response.content.toLowerCase());\n    };\n\n    if (message.content === '!quiz')\n        message.channel.send(item.question).then(() =&gt; {\n            const userData = fs.readdirSync('./Storage').filter(file =&gt; file.endsWith('.json'));\n\n            fs.writeFile('Storage/userData.json', JSON.stringify(), (err) =&gt; {\n                if (err) console.error(err);\n            })\n\n            if (!userData[message.author.id]) userData[message.author.id] = {\n                rightQuizAnswers: 0\n            }\n\n            message.channel.awaitMessages(filter, { max: 1, time: 30000, errors: ['time'] })\n                .then(collected =&gt; {\n                    message.channel.send(`${collected.first().author} acertou!`)\n\n                    userData[message.author.id].rightQuizAnswers++\n                })\n                .catch(collected =&gt; {\n                    message.channel.send('Parece que ninguém acertou :(  (Bando de buro)');\n                });\n        });\n\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>And the quiz is working fine, the only problem is that I the file that was suppost to have the points being stored like this:</p>\n<pre><code>{(the author's ID:{rightQuizAnswers:(number of questions guessed correct)}}\n</code></pre>\n<p>are only being responded with a:</p>\n<pre><code>undefined\n</code></pre>\n<p>To even turn it into a worse problem, when I substituted the 'message.author.id' with my ID, so that it would add a point to rightQuizAnswers, it still returned with <code>undefined</code>...</p>\n<p>Please help</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":480,"question_id":64972772,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I just started learning React, and Mongoose, and how to use JWT tokens for auth, and I just don't realize why I keep getting 401 Unauthorized error for PUT request. My similar POST request works.</p>\n<p>My mongoose schemas look like this:</p>\n<pre><code>const subjectSchema = new mongoose.Schema({\n  content: {\n    type: String,\n    required: true\n  },\n  date: {\n    type: Date,\n    required: true\n  },\n  important: {\n    type: Boolean,\n    default: false\n  },\n  user: {\n    type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId,\n    ref: 'User'\n  }\n})\n\nconst userSchema = new mongoose.Schema({\n    username: {\n        type: String,\n        unique: true \n    },\n    passHash: String,\n    subjects: [\n        {\n            type: mongoose.Schema.Types.ObjectId,\n            ref: 'Subject'\n        }\n    ],\n})\n\nconst Subject = mongoose.model('Subject', subjectSchema, 'subjects')\nconst User = mongoose.model('User', userSchema, 'users')\n</code></pre>\n<p>It's rather simple: if I click on a button a field <em>important</em> of my subject changes from false to true and vice versa.</p>\n<p>And here is the weird thing: if I refresh the page and click on the button it works (value changes) but if I click it again I get 401 Unauthorized error. It is important that the logged in user who tries changing this value is the user who created the subject, if not error 401 must be thrown. I checked and I don't think this has something to do with my JWT token, user is still logged in after the page is refreshed.</p>\n<p>I think I made a mistake somewhere here:</p>\n<pre><code>subjectRouter.put('/:id', async (req, res, next) =&gt; {\n  const data = req.body\n  const id = req.params.id\n  const token = getToken(req)\n  const dekToken = jwt.verify(token, process.env.SECRET)\n  if (!token || !dekToken.id){\n    return res.status(401).json({error: 'something wrong with token'})\n  }\n  const user = await User.findById(dekToken.id)  //the logged in user\n \n  //a copy of sent object\n  const subject = {\n    ...data,\n    user: user._id  //this is where I think I got it wrong, I also tried user.id, and I tried without this line\n  }\n\n  //if I send a put request for the first time these two lines in console have the same value\n  //and my if statement is executed but if I click for another put request data.user.id is undefined?\n  console.log('userId:',user.id);\n  console.log('dataUserId:',data.user.id);\n  //here I compare if the logged in user has the same id as the author of the original subject:\n  if(user.id === data.user.id){\n    const updatedSubject = await Subject.findByIdAndUpdate(id, subject, { new: true })\n    res.json(updatedSubject)\n  } else{\n    return res.status(401).json({error: &quot;user is not the author of this subject&quot;})\n  }\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>And here is my POST request that works:</p>\n<pre><code>subjectRouter.post('/', async (req, res, next) =&gt; {\n  const data = req.body\n  const token = getToken(req)\n  const dekToken = jwt.verify(token, process.env.SECRET)\n  if (!token || !dekToken.id){\n    return res.status(401).json({error: 'something is wrong with token'})\n  }\n  const user = await User.findById(dekToken.id)\n \n  const subject = new Subject({\n    content: data.content,\n    important: data.important || false,\n    date: new Date(),\n    user: user._id\n  })\n  const savedSubject = await subject.save()\n  user.subjects = user.subjects.concat(savedSubject._id)\n  await user.save()\n  res.json(savedSubject)\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>The only difference I see between first and second PUT request on Chrome&gt;Inspect&gt;Network is Request Payload card for the PUT request that works right after refreshing the object has user: { username:&quot;name&quot;, id:&quot;5f9c236502bd2222a4a223b3&quot;} and for the second PUT request on Request Payload card object has user: &quot;5f9c236502bd2222a4a223b3&quot;.\nSo it seems that I do something wrong with referencing the user for the subject.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":485,"question_id":64972750,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I have a bootstrap 4 page with an image that can be changed by the user interacting with several dropdowns. Based on the selected options, the image source is changed. The images are fairly large, so loading the requested image takes some time. Since my columns are not fixed-width, I want to display the spinner on top of the image rather than swapping the image source for the spinner, so all of the content remains in the correct positions.</p>\n<p>Example code:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div class=&quot;container-fluid&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;div class=&quot;row justify-content-center&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;col-12 col-lg-auto&quot; style=&quot;background-color:red;&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;h2&gt;Column 1&lt;/h2&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;col-12 col-lg-auto&quot; style=&quot;background-color:green;&quot; &gt;\n            &lt;h2 class=&quot;header-2&quot;&gt;Column 2&lt;/h2&gt;\n            &lt;img class=&quot;img-fluid&quot; src=&quot;https://via.placeholder.com/500x350&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;col-12 col-lg-auto&quot; style=&quot;background-color:blue;&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;h2&gt;Column 3&lt;/h2&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":493,"question_id":64972642,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>So I wanted to make the DVD bouncing screen in HTML and Javascript, but I am having trouble getting the ball to be the DVD logo and changing the color when a bounce happens ball or image. Does anyone know how to change the ball to be an image and change its color when a bounce happens?</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    \n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;script&gt;\n            var context;\n            var x=100;\n            var y=100;\n            var dx=5;\n            var dy=2;\n\n            function init()\n            {\n              context= myCanvas.getContext('2d');\n              setInterval(draw,20);\n            }\n\n            function draw()\n            {\n                //base_image = new Image();\n                //base_image.src = 'dvd.png';\n                //context.drawImage(base_image, 100, 100);\n                //base_image.arc(x,y,20,0,Math.PI*2,true);\n                \n                \n                context.clearRect(0,0, 600,600);\n                context.beginPath();\n                context.fillStyle=\"#0000ff\";\n                //Draws a circle of radius 20 at the coordinates 100,100 on the canvas\n                context.arc(x,y,20,0,Math.PI*2,true); \n                context.closePath();\n                context.fill();\n                \n                \n                // Boundary Logic\n                if (x &lt; 0 || x &gt; 600){\n                    dx = -dx;\n                    context.fillStyle=\"#77ff00\";\n                }\n                if (y &lt; 0 || y &gt; 600){\n                    dy = -dy;\n                }\n                x+=dx;\n                y+=dy;\n            }\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n        \n        //&lt;img src=\"dvd.png\" id=\"dvd\" width=\"100\" height=\"100\"&gt;\n        &lt;body onLoad=\"init();\"&gt;\n          &lt;canvas id=\"myCanvas\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" &gt;\n          &lt;/canvas&gt;\n    &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":495,"question_id":64972594,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>The code requires an external script the jquery-2.2.4.min.js which I copied and linked before running my actual script. I tried following a suggestion from another question similar to mine so excuse the mess. If someone could find my mistake or issue lmk. Codepen code: <a href=\"https://codepen.io/goularte11/pen/zYBgPNe\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://codepen.io/goularte11/pen/zYBgPNe</a></p>\n<p><strong>Code for index.html:</strong></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;meta name=&quot;viewport&quot; content=&quot;width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;meta http-equiv=&quot;X-UA_Compatible&quot; content=&quot;ie=edge&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;title&gt;Countdown Bar&lt;/title&gt;\n    &lt;link href=&quot;style.css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;script src=&quot;jquery-2.2.4.min.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n    &lt;script&gt;\n        function progress(timeleft, timetotal, $element) {\n    var progressBarWidth = $element.width()*(timeleft/timetotal);\n    $element.find('div').animate({ width: progressBarWidth }, 500).html(Math.floor(timeleft/60) + &quot;:&quot;+ timeleft%60);\n    if(timeleft &lt; timetotal) {\n        setTimeout(function() {\n            progress(timeleft +1, timetotal, $element);\n        }, 1000);\n    }\n};\n\nprogress(0, 300, $('#progressBar'));\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n\n&lt;/head&gt;\n&lt;body&gt;\n    &lt;div id=&quot;progressBar&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;bar&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Code for style.css</strong></p>\n<pre><code>#progressBar {\n    width: 90%;\n   background-color: #ddd;\n }\n \n #progressBar div {\n  width: 10%;\n   height: 30px;\n   background-color: #4CAF50;\n   text-align: center;\n   line-height: 30px;\n   color: white;\n   box-sizing: border-box;\n }\n \n /* Do not take in account */\n html{padding-top:30px}a.solink{position:fixed;top:0;width:100%;text-align:center;background:#f3f5f6;color:#cfd6d9;border:1px solid #cfd6d9;line-height:30px;text-decoration:none;transition:all .3s;z-index:999}a.solink::first-letter{text-transform:capitalize}a.solink:hover{color:#428bca}\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Code for script.jss:</strong></p>\n<pre><code>function progress(timeleft, timetotal, $element) {\n    var progressBarWidth = $element.width()*(timeleft/timetotal);\n    $element.find('div').animate({ width: progressBarWidth }, 500).html(Math.floor(timeleft/60) + &quot;:&quot;+ timeleft%60);\n    if(timeleft &lt; timetotal) {\n        setTimeout(function() {\n            progress(timeleft +1, timetotal, $element);\n        }, 1000);\n    }\n};\n\nprogress(0, 300, $('#progressBar'));\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":494,"question_id":64972623,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm trying to create a Mega Menu that triggers on Hover, using Tailwind CSS and Alpinejs. I kind of having it working, but it's really buggy.</p>\n<p>I've tried adding x-on:mouseleave to different elements but it will either flicker constantly or only disappear when moving away from certain areas. So it will either disappear when moving below the menu and not when moving above and vice versa.</p>\n<p>Any insight would be much appreciated!</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://codepen.io/kennyk3/pen/yLJmzYJ\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://codepen.io/kennyk3/pen/yLJmzYJ</a></p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;bg-blue-800 hidden md:block&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div class=&quot;max-w-screen-xl mx-auto&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;nav class=&quot;flex items-center justify-between flex-wrap&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;div class=&quot;w-full block flex-grow md:flex md:items-center md:w-auto&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;font-bold md:flex-grow&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;ul class=&quot;flex justify-between&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;li&gt;\n              &lt;a href=&quot;#&quot; class=&quot;block p-4 text-blue-100 hover:bg-blue-900 transition duration-500&quot;&gt;LINK&lt;/a&gt;\n            &lt;/li&gt;\n            &lt;li&gt;\n              &lt;a href=&quot;#&quot; class=&quot;block p-4 text-blue-100 hover:bg-blue-900 transition duration-500&quot;&gt;LINK&lt;/a&gt;\n            &lt;/li&gt;\n            &lt;li&gt;\n              &lt;a href=&quot;#&quot; {"body":"<p>i am struggling to understand why when i use expo to start viewing my project on my iphone it throws back an error stating it cant find the variable StyleSheet? this code was working when i opened it last and now gives me around 20 errors. wondering if anyone has has a simular issue and managed to fix it?\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/SU0Ym.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">enter image description here</a></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":497,"question_id":64972572,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Looking for a way to format the result of calculations with comma for thousand parts (10,000). Since I added <code>.toLocaleString('en-US', {maximumFractionDigits:1});</code> to the output numbers, when I check and uncheck options, the result is getting strange.</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>var checkboxes = document.querySelectorAll('.sum')\nvar select = document.querySelector('#select')\nvar total3 = document.querySelector('#payment-total')\nvar total6 = document.querySelector('#payment-total2')\nvar total12 = document.querySelector('#payment-total3')\nconst totalScreenDiv = document.querySelector('#total-screen');\nconst totalRangeDiv = document.querySelector('#total-range');\nconst totalOtherDiv = document.querySelector('#total-other');\nconst screen1 = document.querySelector('#screen-1');\nconst screen2 = document.querySelector('#screen-2');\nconst screen3 = document.querySelector('#screen-3');\nconst range1 = document.querySelector('#range-1');\nconst range2 = document.querySelector('#range-2');\nconst range3 = document.querySelector('#range-3');\nconst other1 = document.querySelector('#other-1');\nconst other2 = document.querySelector('#other-2');\nconst other3 = document.querySelector('#other-3');\n\n\n\nvar screenwad = 5\nvar screenkalw = 6\nvar screenzat = 4\nvar totalscreen = document.querySelector('#total-screen')\n\n\n\nvar checkboxesTotal = 0;\nvar selectTotal = 0;\n\ncheckboxes.forEach(function(input) {\n  input.addEventListener('change', onCheckboxSelect)\n})\n\nselect.addEventListener('click', onSelectChange)\n\nfunction onCheckboxSelect(e) {\n  var sign = e.target.checked ? 1 : -1\n  checkboxesTotal += sign * parseInt(e.target.value, 10);\n  \n  const summary = getSummary(e.target);\n  \n  var select = document.getElementById(\"select\");\n  // get selected value and assign it to the global variable selectTotal\n  selectTotal = select.options[select.selectedIndex].value;\n  renderTotal();\n  renderSummary(summary);\n}\n\nfunction onSelectChange(e) {\n  var value = parseInt(e.target.value, 10)\n  if (!isNaN(value)) {\n    selectTotal = value\n    renderTotal()\n  }\n}\n\nfunction getSummary(selectedDiv) {\n  const data = {totalScreen: +totalScreenDiv.innerText.replace(',',''), totalRange: +totalRangeDiv.innerText.replace(',', ''), totalOther: +totalOtherDiv.innerText.replace(',', '')};\n\n  const sign = selectedDiv.checked ? 1 : -1;\n  if(selectedDiv.getAttribute('id') === 'styled-checkbox-1') {\n    if(sign === 1) {\n      data.totalScreen += +(screen1.innerText.replace(',', ''));\n      data.totalRange += +(range1.innerText.replace(',', ''));\n      data.totalOther += +(other1.innerText.replace(',', ''));\n    } else {\n      if(data.totalScreen &gt; 0) data.totalScreen -= +(screen2.innerText.replace(',', ''));\n      if(data.totalRange &gt; 0) data.totalRange -= +(range2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      if(data.totalOther &gt; 0) data.totalOther -= +(other3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n    }\n  } else if(selectedDiv.getAttribute('id') === 'styled-checkbox-2') {\n    if(sign === 1) {\n      data.totalScreen += +(screen2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      data.totalRange += +(range2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      data.totalOther += +(other2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n    } else {\n      if(data.totalScreen &gt; 0) data.totalScreen -= +(screen2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      if(data.totalRange &gt; 0) data.totalRange -= +(range2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      if(data.totalOther &gt; 0) data.totalOther -= +(other2.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n    }\n  } else if(selectedDiv.getAttribute('id') === 'styled-checkbox-3') {\n    if(sign === 1) {\n      data.totalScreen += +(screen3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      data.totalRange += +(range3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      data.totalOther += +(other3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n    } else {\n      if(data.totalScreen &gt; 0) data.totalScreen -= +(screen3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      if(data.totalRange &gt; 0) data.totalRange -= +(range3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n      if(data.totalOther &gt; 0) data.totalOther -= +(other3.innerText.replace(',', ''))\n    }\n  }\n  \n  return data;\n}\n\n\nfunction renderSummary({totalScreen, totalRange, totalOther}) {\n  totalScreenDiv.innerHTML = totalScreen.toLocaleString('en-US', {maximumFractionDigits:1});\n  totalRangeDiv.innerHTML = totalRange.toLocaleString('en-US', {maximumFractionDigits:1});\n  totalOtherDiv.innerHTML = totalOther.toLocaleString('en-US', {maximumFractionDigits:1});\n}\n\n\n\nfunction renderTotal() {\n  //NORMALNA CENA\n  total3.innerHTML = checkboxesTotal * selectTotal \n  // 10% TANIEJ\n  total6.innerHTML = (checkboxesTotal * selectTotal / 100) * (-10) + (checkboxesTotal * selectTotal)\n  // 20% TANIEJ\n  total12.innerHTML = (checkboxesTotal * selectTotal / 100) * (-20) + (checkboxesTotal * selectTotal)\n\n  //WADOWICE\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>/*CENNIK*/\nbody {\n    margin: 0;\n    font-family: Europa;\n}\n.pt_title {\n    text-align: center;\n    background: #2c4949;\n    color: #fff;\n    font-size: 20px;\n    height: 60px;\n    line-height: 60px;\n}\n.pt_months {\n    color: #fff;\n    background: #9B8C70;\n    height: 70px;\n    line-height: 70px;\n}\n.col-x.month {\n    text-align: center;\n}\n.cennik .pt-container {\n    padding: 0 100px;\n}\n.col-x {\n    display: inline-block;\n    width: 25%;\n    float: left;\n}\n.pt_sub {\n    background: #F4F1ED;\n    height: 40px;\n    line-height: 40px;\n    box-shadow: 0px 1px 2px 0px #00000029;\n    z-index: 9;\n    position: relative;\n}\n.pt_sub .col-x {\n    color: #352B25;\n    font-size: 14px;\n    font-weight: 100;\n}\n/*TABLE*/\n.cennik ul li {\n    list-style: none!important;\n    float: left;\n    min-width: 100%;\n    background: #e6e6e6;\n    border-bottom: 1px solid #00000021;\n    margin-left: 0!important;\n    padding-left: 0px !important;\n}\n.cennik ul {\n    list-style: none;\n    margin: 0;\n    padding: 0;\n}\n.pt-place {\n    padding: 15px 0;\n}\n.pt-place .month {\n    font-weight: 700;\n    color: #2c4949;\n}\n.pt_table ul {\n    display: inline-block;\n    position: relative;\n    width: 100%;\n}\n.pt-place .month span {\n    font-size: 16px;\n    font-weight: 700;\n    color: #2c4949;\n}\n.pt_months .month {\n    font-size: 20px;\n    text-transform: uppercase;\n    font-weight: 700;\n}\n/*CHECKBOX*/\n.checkbox.col-x {\n    color: #858585;\n    font-weight: 700;\n}\n.checkbox.col-x span:hover {\n    color: #354949;\n}\n.styled-checkbox {\n     position: absolute;\n     opacity: 0;\n}\n .styled-checkbox + label {\n     position: relative;\n     cursor: pointer;\n     padding: 0;\n}\n.styled-checkbox + label:before {\n    content: '';\n    margin-right: 10px;\n    display: inline-block;\n    vertical-align: text-top;\n    width: 24px;\n    height: 24px;\n    background: #ffffff00;\n    border: 2px solid #858585;\n    border-radius: 6px;\n    box-sizing: border-box;\n    -moz-box-sizing: border-box;\n    -webkit-box-sizing: border-box;\n    -webkit-transition: all 0.1s ease;\n    -moz-transition: all 0.1s ease;\n    -o-transition: all 0.1s ease;\n    transition: all 0.1s ease;\n}\n.styled-checkbox:hover + label:before {\n    background: #ffffff00;\n    border: 4px solid #9B8C70;\n}\n .styled-checkbox:focus + label:before {\n     box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.12);\n}\n.styled-checkbox:checked + label:before {\n    background: #9B8C70;\n}\n .styled-checkbox:disabled + label {\n     color: #b8b8b8;\n     cursor: auto;\n}\n .styled-checkbox:disabled + label:before {\n     box-shadow: none;\n     background: #ddd;\n}\n.styled-checkbox:checked + label:after {\n    content: '';\n    position: absolute;\n    left: 6.5px;\n    top: 14px;\n    background: #FDF1D1;\n    width: 2px;\n    height: 2px;\n    box-shadow: 2px 0 0 #FDF1D1, 4px 0 0 #FDF1D1, 4px -2px 0 #FDF1D1, 4px -4px 0 #FDF1D1, 4px -6px 0 #FDF1D1, 4px -8px 0 #FDF1D1;\n    transform: rotate(45deg);\n}\n.pt-place.disabled {\n    opacity: 0.5;\n}\nspan.discount {\n    color: #FFD383!important;\n}\n.cennik li.pt-place:hover {\n    background: #f4f1ed;\n}\n.pt_footer {\n    font-size: 14px;\n    font-weight: 700;\n    color: #FDF1D1;\n    background: #2c4949;\n    padding: 20px 0;\n    display: inline-block;\n    width: 100%;\n}\n.pt_footer span {\n    color: #FDF1D1;\n    font-size: 14px;\n    text-transform: uppercase;\n    font-weight: 700;\n    letter-spacing: 2px;\n}\n#payment-total,#payment-total2,#payment-total3 {\n    font-size: 20px;\n    color: #fff;\n    letter-spacing: 0px;\n}\n.currency {\n    color: #fff!important;\n    text-transform: lowercase!important;\n    font-size: 20px!important;\n    letter-spacing: 0px!important;\n}\n.col-x.spot span {\n    letter-spacing: 0px;\n    margin-right: 10px;\n    color: #fff;\n    text-transform: inherit;\n    font-size: 16px;\n}\n.col-x.spot {\n    margin-top: 5px;\n}\n\n\n\n\n.cennik select {\n    background-color: white;\n    border-radius: 30px;\n    display: {"body":"<p>So I am fairly new to React hooks, and I am trying to use similar variables over again.</p>\n<p>I want to have several buttons, each of which launch a different login mechanism, like so:</p>\n<pre><code>export default function App() {\n\n    let [request, response, onGoogleLoginButtonPress] = Google.useAuthRequest({\n      responseType: ResponseType.Token,\n      clientId: 'NUMBER',\n    });\n    let [request, response, onFBLoginButtonPress] = Facebook.useAuthRequest({\n      responseType: ResponseType.Token,\n      clientId: 'NUMBER',\n    });\n\nreturn(\n\n            &lt;View&gt;\n              &lt;TouchableOpacity style={[styles.googleRed, styles.loginButton]}\n                  self={this} onPress={() =&gt; onGoogleLoginButtonPress()}&gt;\n                  &lt;View&gt;&lt;/View&gt;\n                  &lt;Text style={styles.loginText}&gt;Log In with Google&lt;/Text&gt;\n                  &lt;Image style={styles.loginImg} source={GoogleImg} /&gt;\n              &lt;/TouchableOpacity&gt;\n              &lt;TouchableOpacity style={[styles.facebookBlue, styles.loginButton]}\n                  self={this} onPress={() =&gt; onFBLoginButtonPress()}&gt;\n                  &lt;View&gt;&lt;/View&gt;\n                  &lt;Text style={styles.loginText}&gt;Log In with Facebook&lt;/Text&gt;\n                  &lt;Image style={styles.loginImg} source={FBImg} /&gt;\n              &lt;/TouchableOpacity&gt;\n            &lt;/View&gt;\n);\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>This doesn't work, because request and response are being re-used.</p>\n<p>Now I suppose I could re-name them fbRequest and googleRequest, etc, but that just seems messy and like adding unnecessary variables - if there's a request, it will only be ONE request.</p>\n<p>How do I re-use these variables whilst still populating them with the relevant function?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":498,"question_id":64972565,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>TypeError: can't access property &quot;textContent&quot;, document.querySelector(...) is null is being displayed when I try changing the using a querySelector.</p>\n<p>I created a const named getCardContent to then return a div with text and images.</p>\n<p>I just wanted to be able to change the text as I thought I could use the code as a template.\nBelow is a link to my codepen project.\n<a href=\"https://codepen.io/lenniefinch/pen/eYzLdGp\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://codepen.io/lenniefinch/pen/eYzLdGp</a></p>\n<pre><code>            const cards = document.querySelectorAll('.card');\n\n        const toggleExpansion = (element, to, duration = 350) =&gt; {\n            return new Promise((res) =&gt; {\n                requestAnimationFrame(() =&gt; {\n                    element.style.transition = `\n                        width ${duration}ms ease-in-out,\n                        height ${duration}ms ease-in-out,\n                        left ${duration}ms ease-in-out,\n                        top ${duration}ms ease-in-out\n                    `;\n                    element.style.top = to.top;\n                    element.style.left = to.left;\n                    element.style.width = to.width;\n                    element.style.height = to.height;\n                });\n                setTimeout(res, duration);\n            })\n        }\n\n        const fadeContent = (element, opacity, duration = 300) =&gt; {\n            return new Promise(res =&gt; {\n                [...element.children].forEach((child) =&gt; {\n                    requestAnimationFrame(() =&gt; {\n                        child.style.transition = `opacity ${duration}ms linear`;\n                        child.style.opacity = opacity;\n                    });\n                })\n                setTimeout(res, duration);\n            })\n        }\n\n        const getCardContent = (title, type, desc) =&gt; {\n            return `\n                &lt;div class=&quot;card-content&quot;&gt;\n                    &lt;h2&gt;${title}&lt;/h2&gt;\n                    &lt;img src=&quot;${type}.png&quot;&gt;\n                    &lt;p id=&quot;demo&quot;&gt;${desc}&lt;/p&gt;\n        \n                        &lt;h1 class=&quot;bro&quot;&gt;The Mission&lt;/h1&gt;\n                \n                &lt;p class=&quot;brother&quot;&gt;Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Nunc sed blandit libero volutpat. Convallis convallis tellus id interdum velit laoreet id donec. Nibh venenatis cras sed felis eget velit aliquet. Dolor eum ipsa molestiae nesciunt nostrum porro\n                    reprehenderit? Animi corporis deleniti dolore laborum, nemo pariatur temporibus voluptatem.\n                &lt;/p&gt;\n\n\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n            `;\n        }\n    \n    //new way\n\n/*const myDiv = document.getElementById('myDiv');\nmyDiv.dataset.desc = 'bob'; */\n    \ndocument.querySelector('.bro').textContent = 'This text is different!';\n\n\n\n\n        const onCardClick = async (e) =&gt; {\n            const card = e.currentTarget;\n            // clone the card\n            const cardClone = card.cloneNode(true);\n            // get the location of the card in the view\n            const {top, left, width, height} = card.getBoundingClientRect();\n            // position the clone on top of the original\n            cardClone.style.position = 'fixed';\n            cardClone.style.top = top + 'px';\n            cardClone.style.left = left + 'px';\n            cardClone.style.width = width + 'px';\n            cardClone.style.height = height + 'px';\n            // hide the original card with opacity\n            card.style.opacity = '0';\n            // add card to the same container\n            card.parentNode.appendChild(cardClone);\n            // create a close button to handle the undo\n            const closeButton = document.createElement('button');\n            // position the close button top corner\n            closeButton.style = `\n                position: fixed;\n                z-index: 10000;\n                top: 35px;\n                right: 35px;\n                width: 35px;\n                height: 35px;\n                border-radius: 50%;\n                background-color: #3e3e3f;\n        color: #eaeaea;\n        font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif;\n            `;\n      \n        // and give it some content \n  const newContent = document.createTextNode(&quot;X&quot;); \n  \n  // add the text node to the newly created div\n  closeButton.appendChild(newContent); \n      \n      \n            // attach click event to the close button\n            closeButton.addEventListener('click', async () =&gt; {\n                // remove the button on close\n                closeButton.remove();\n                // remove the display style so the original content is displayed right\n                cardClone.style.removeProperty('display');\n                cardClone.style.removeProperty('padding');\n                // show original card content\n                [...cardClone.children].forEach(child =&gt; child.style.removeProperty('display'));\n                fadeContent(cardClone, '0');\n                // shrink the card back to the original position and size\n                await toggleExpansion(cardClone, {top: `${top}px`, left: `${left}px`, width: `${width}px`, height: `${height}px`}, 300)\n                // show the original card again\n                card.style.removeProperty('opacity');\n                // remove the clone card\n                cardClone.remove();\n            });\n            // fade the content away\n            fadeContent(cardClone, '0')\n                .then(() =&gt; {\n                    [...cardClone.children].forEach(child =&gt; child.style.display = 'none');\n                });\n            // expand the clone card\n            await toggleExpansion(cardClone, {top: 0, left: 0, width: '100vw', height: '100vh'});\n            const content = getCardContent(card.textContent, card.dataset.type)\n            // set the display block so the content will follow the normal flow in case the original card is not display block\n            cardClone.style.display = 'block';\n            cardClone.style.padding = '0';\n            // append the close button after the expansion is done\n            cardClone.appendChild(closeButton);\n            cardClone.insertAdjacentHTML('afterbegin', content);\n        };\n\n        cards.forEach(card =&gt; card.addEventListener('click', onCardClick));\n\n//function getCardContent(card.textContent, card.dataset.type, card.dataset.desc);\n\nconst p = document.createElement('p');\nconst hi = document.createTextNode('hi');\nconst james = document.createTextNode('james');\np.appendChild(hi);\np.appendChild(james);\ndocument.body.appendChild(p);\n</code></pre>\n<pre><code>    &lt;div class=&quot;grid-container cards&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;div id=&quot;myDiv&quot; {"body":"<p>I'm designing a temperature converter and trying to get the conversion function to change depending on the unit selected. Fahrenheit is the default calculation and I can't seem to change it to the other conversions when the unit is switched. How can I add my conversion functions into my switch statement?</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>// Select unit\nconst units = document.querySelector('#units');\n\nunits.addEventListener('change', function(e) {  \n  let selectedUnit = units.selectedIndex;\n  let degree = document.querySelector('#degree');  \n        \n  switch(selectedUnit) {\n    case 0:\n    degree.innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;F\";\n    document.getElementById('tag1').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;C\";\n    document.getElementById('tag2').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;R\";\n    document.getElementById('tag3').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;K\";\n    document.getElementById('fahrenheit').placeholder = \"Degrees fahrenheit\";\n    \n    break;\n\n    case 1:\n    degree.innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;C\";    \n    document.getElementById('tag1').innerHTML = \"K\";\n    document.getElementById('tag2').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;R\";\n    document.getElementById('tag3').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;F\";\n    document.getElementById('fahrenheit').placeholder = \"Degrees Celsius\";\n    break;\n\n    case 2:\n    degree.innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;R\";    \n    document.getElementById('tag1').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;C\";\n    document.getElementById('tag2').innerHTML = \"K\";\n    document.getElementById('tag3').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;F\";\n    document.getElementById('fahrenheit').placeholder = \"Degrees Rankine\";\n    break;\n\n    case 3:    \n    degree.innerHTML = \"K\";        \n    document.getElementById('tag1').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;C\";\n    document.getElementById('tag2').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;R\";\n    document.getElementById('tag3').innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;F\";\n    document.getElementById('fahrenheit').placeholder = \"Kelvin\";\n    break;\n\n    default:\n    degree.innerHTML = \"&amp;deg;F\";\n    document.getElementById('fahrenheit').placeholder = \"Degrees Fahrenheit\";\n    break;\n  }\n});\n\n// Listen for submit\ndocument.querySelector('#temp-form').addEventListener('submit', function(e) {\n  // Hide results\n  document.querySelector('#results').style.display = 'none';\n\n  // Show loader\n  document.querySelector('#loading').style.display = 'block';\n\n  setTimeout(calculateResults, 2000);\n  \n  e.preventDefault();\n});\n\n// Calculate Results\nfunction calculateResults(e){\n  console.log('Calculating...');\n  // UI Vars\n  const fahrenheitInput = document.querySelector('#fahrenheit');\n  const celsiusInput = document.querySelector('#celsius');\n  const rankineInput = document.querySelector('#rankine');\n  const kelvinInput = document.querySelector('#kelvin');\n\n  function fahrenheitConversion() {\n    const ftemp = parseFloat(fahrenheitInput.value);\n    const ctemp = (ftemp - 32) * (5/9);\n    const rtemp = ftemp + 459.67;\n    const ktemp = (ftemp - 32) * (5/9) + 273.15;\n    \n    celsiusInput.value = ctemp.toFixed(2);\n    rankineInput.value = rtemp.toFixed(2);\n    kelvinInput.value = ktemp.toFixed(2);\n  }\n\n  function celsiusConversion() {\n    const ctemp = parseFloat(celsiusInput.value);\n    const ftemp = (ctemp * (9/5)) + 32;\n    const rtemp = (ctemp * (9/5)) + 491.67;\n    const ktemp = ctemp + 273.15;\n    \n    fahrenheitInput.value = ftemp.toFixed(2);\n    rankineInput.value = rtemp.toFixed(2);\n    kelvinInput.value = ktemp.toFixed(2);\n  }\n\n  function rankineConversion() {\n    const rtemp = parseFloat(rankineInput.value);\n    const ctemp = (rtemp - 491.67) * (5/9);\n    const ftemp = rtemp - 459.67;\n    const ktemp = rtemp * (5/9);\n    \n    celsiusInput.value = ctemp.toFixed(2);\n    fahrenheitInput.value = ftemp.toFixed(2);\n    kelvinInput.value = ktemp.toFixed(2);\n  }\n\n  function kelvinConversion() {\n    const ktemp = parseFloat(kelvinInput.value);\n    const ctemp = ktemp - 273.15;\n    const rtemp = ktemp * (9/5);\n    const ftemp = (ktemp - 273.15) * (9/5) + 32;\n    \n    celsiusInput.value = ctemp.toFixed(2);\n    rankineInput.value = rtemp.toFixed(2);\n    fahrenheitInput.value = ftemp.toFixed(2);\n  }\n  \n  // Show results\n  document.querySelector('#results').style.display = 'block';\n\n  // Hide loader\n  document.querySelector('#loading').style.display = 'none';\n\n  fahrenheitInput.addEventListener('submit', fahrenheitConversion());\n  celsiusInput.addEventListener('submit', celsiusConversion());\n  rankineInput.addEventListener('submit', rankineConversion());\n  kelvinInput.addEventListener('submit', kelvinConversion());\n}</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":507,"question_id":64972331,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

+ err);\n             });\n\n         video.addEventListener('canplay', function(ev) {\n             if (!streaming) {\n                 height = video.videoHeight / (video.videoWidth / width);\n\n                 if (isNaN(height)) {\n                     height = width / (4 / 3);\n                 }\n\n                 video.setAttribute('width', width);\n                 video.setAttribute('height', height);\n                 canvas.setAttribute('width', width);\n                 canvas.setAttribute('height', height);\n                 streaming = true;\n             }\n         }, false);\n\n         startbutton.addEventListener('click', function(ev) {\n             takepicture();\n             ev.preventDefault();\n         }, false);\n\n         clearphoto();\n     }\n\n\n     function clearphoto() {\n         var context = canvas.getContext('2d');\n         context.fillStyle = &quot;#AAA&quot;;\n         context.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);\n\n         var data = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');\n         photo.setAttribute('src', data);\n     }\n\n     function takepicture() {\n         var context = canvas.getContext('2d');\n         if (width &amp;&amp; height) {\n             canvas.width = width;\n             canvas.height = height;\n             context.drawImage(video, 0, 0, width, height);\n\n             var data = canvas.toDataURL('image/png');\n             photo.setAttribute('src', data);\n         } else {\n             clearphoto();\n         }\n     }\n\n     window.addEventListener('load', startup, false);\n })();\n</code></pre>\n<p>any help or direction would be greatly appreciated</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":509,"question_id":64972308,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I have a json object list (carriers) like this:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/0FAKw.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/0FAKw.png\" alt=\"json data\" /></a></p>\n<p>In my *.vue I render this with:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;tr v-for=&quot;carrier in this.carriers&quot;&gt;\n   &lt;td&gt;{{ carrier.id }}&lt;/td&gt; ....\n</code></pre>\n<p>My thead / th's can be clicked for sorting the table like this:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;thead&gt;\n   &lt;tr&gt;\n      &lt;th class=&quot;pointer link&quot; @click=&quot;sort('id')&quot;&gt;\n         ID\n         &lt;span v-if=&quot;'id' === currentSortCol&quot;&gt;\n            {{currentSortDir ==='asc' ? '&amp;#8593;':'&amp;#8595;'}}\n         &lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;/th&gt;\n      &lt;th class=&quot;pointer link&quot; @click=&quot;sort('region.name')&quot;&gt;\n         Region\n         &lt;span v-if=&quot;'region.name' === currentSortCol&quot;&gt;\n            {{currentSortDir ==='asc' ? '&amp;#8593;':'&amp;#8595;'}}\n         &lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;/th&gt;....\n</code></pre>\n<p>and my sort method is like this:</p>\n<pre><code>        sort(col) {\n            if (this.currentSortCol === col) {\n                this.currentSortDir = this.currentSortDir === &quot;asc&quot; ? &quot;desc&quot; : &quot;asc&quot;;\n            } else {\n                this.currentSortCol = col;\n            }\n            this.carriers.sort(this.sortBy(col, this.currentSortDir));\n        },\n        sortBy(property, order) {\n            this.currnetSortDir=order;\n            return function(a, b) {\n                const varA =\n                    typeof a[property] === &quot;string&quot;\n                        ? a[property].toUpperCase()\n                        : a[property];\n                const varB =\n                    typeof b[property] === &quot;string&quot;\n                        ? b[property].toUpperCase()\n                        : b[property];\n\n                let comparison = 0;\n                if (varA &gt; varB) comparison = 1;\n                else if (varA &lt; varB) comparison = -1;\n                return order === &quot;desc&quot; ? comparison * -1 : comparison;\n            };\n        }\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>Problem:</strong>\nThe sorting asc, desc is fine with the ID (carrier.id) . {"body":"<p><strong>Goal</strong>: Show bootstrap modal/popup upon (radio)button click, AND send data to it.</p>\n<p>This is the set of radio buttons:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/KaVgj.jpg\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/KaVgj.jpg\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>This is what the modal dialog looks like:\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/JOBzu.jpg\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/JOBzu.jpg\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p><strong>Problem</strong>: I can open the modal dialog with javascript, but then I cant trigger a c# event at the same time to send the data. How can I call the javascript FROM the C# Event?</p>\n<p><strong>What I've tried</strong>: Many solutions mention variations of ScriptManager, but this either did nothing, or it required to be in a form and other pre requisites. I've also tried it from a text element. I've also tried hidden elements.\nLooked through: <a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15410232/open-bootstrap-modal-from-code-behind\">Open Bootstrap Modal from code-behind</a>  , <a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17559050/how-to-pass-data-from-parent-html-window-to-pop-up-window\">How to pass data from Parent html window to pop-up window</a>  ,  <a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31301683/show-modal-dialog-confirmation-box-based-on-user-input-in-code-behind-asp-net\">Show Modal Dialog/Confirmation Box Based on User Input in Code Behind/ASP.net</a>\nWhat is the easiest way to do what I'm trying to do?</p>\n<p><strong>ASPX/HTML</strong>:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;avborder&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;asp:Panel ID=&quot;row3&quot; {"body":"<p>I have created 2 scripts that are very similar. They flip tickets to a different queue based on a CTI (category, type and item). I've tried to combine them by myself but failed to create a working script.</p>\n<p>so, let me provide a bit more of context whenever reviewers have to flip a ticket they have to manually select the Category, Type, and Item they want to flip it to. The idea of these 2 scripts is to help automatize that. I created the first script and it works fine, this one flips the tickets to 'team1'. Then I created the second script for tickets to be flipped to 'team 2', and it worked fine, then I came across the first issue, if both scripts are enabled at the same time only script 1 will work. For script 2 to function I have to disable script 1.</p>\n<p>How can I combine those userscripts together? Any thoughts and guidance will be highly appreciated</p>\n<p>Script 1</p>\n<pre><code>// ==UserScript==\n// @name         Flip_TT_UTC5_Dropdown\n// @description  Provides the ability for DG Ticketing teams to flip tickets\n// @version      1.0.0\n// @grant        GM_xmlhttpRequest\n\n\nfunction add_usage() {\n    GM_xmlhttpRequest({\n        method: &quot;GET&quot;,\n        url: &quot;https://ssa-central.aka.amazon.com/ssa/tool/Flip_TT_Dropdown/1.0.0/add-usage&quot;,\n    });\n}\n\n\nvar placement = document.getElementById(&quot;action_bar&quot;);\n\n//function to add Flip To button\n\nvar fliplist = document.createElement('div');\nfliplist.innerHTML = `&lt;label&gt; UTC5 FC TT &lt;/label&gt;&lt;select id=&quot;flipttrkshtd&quot;&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;1&quot;&gt;Dangerous Goods (Hazmat) - WW Classification - C-Ops Conflicting Detail Pages&lt;/option&gt;\n\n&lt;/select&gt;`;\n\nplacement.append(fliplist);\n\nvar submitDataButton = document.createElement('button');\nsubmitDataButton.setAttribute('class','submitButton');\nsubmitDataButton.setAttribute('id','flippingiddata');\nsubmitDataButton.innerHTML = `\n        &lt;span&gt;Flip TT &lt;/span&gt;\n`;\nplacement.append(submitDataButton);\n\n//function to change CTIs\n\ndocument.getElementById(&quot;flippingiddata&quot;).addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;,function(){\nvar testsss = document.getElementById(&quot;flipttrkshtd&quot;).value;\n\n\nswitch (testsss)\n{\ncase &quot;1&quot;:\n    var cti = {\n    '#category': 'Dangerous Goods (Hazmat)',\n    '#type': 'WW Classification',\n    '#item': 'C-Ops - Conflicting Detail Pages',\n    '#assigned_group': 'PC Classification UTC5',\n    '#assigned_individual': 'WW PC Classification UTC5'};\n    break;\n}\n\n$.each(cti, function(jq_id, value) {\n$('&lt;option&gt;', {value: value, text: value}).appendTo(jq_id);\n$(jq_id).val(value);\n});\n\n$('#save-button').click();\nadd_usage()\n\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>Script 2</p>\n<pre><code>// ==UserScript==\n// @name CA&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;4&quot;&gt;FC OUT US&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;5&quot;&gt;FC OUT MX&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;6&quot;&gt;FC OUT CA&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;7&quot;&gt;FBA US&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;8&quot;&gt;FBA MX&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;9&quot;&gt;FBA CA&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;13&quot;&gt;SPS US&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;14&quot;&gt;SPS MX&lt;/option&gt;\n&lt;option value=&quot;15&quot;&gt;SPS CA&lt;/option&gt;\n\n&lt;/select&gt;`;\n\nplacement.append(fliplist);\n\nvar submitDataButton = document.createElement('button');\nsubmitDataButton.setAttribute('class','submitButton');\nsubmitDataButton.setAttribute('id','flippingiddata');\nsubmitDataButton.innerHTML = `\n {"body":"<p>I am new in PHP and passing location name when link click, its open new location details page\nand its URL like</p>\n<pre><code>https://example.com/location/?id=mylocation\n</code></pre>\n<p>Instead I want pass it like below</p>\n<pre><code>https://example.com/location/mylocation\n</code></pre>\n<p>There any way for do it so I can pass value like above and still I can get it by <code>$_REQUEST</code> method in details page?</p>\n<p>Thanks!</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":519,"question_id":64972014,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Hi I'm trying to create a small program to<br />\nchange a string based on a HTML radio input,\nThink I've got the basics of it complete\nbut not sure I'm doing it the correct way,\nI'm trying to use a PHP switch but do not know which part I am supposed to attach the switch to. Currently its trying to grab the fieldset, and switch based on the radio options set within that switch.</p>\n<p>my PHP code is below:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!doctype html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n  &lt;head&gt;\n     &lt;title&gt;String Alteration&lt;/title&gt;\n     &lt;link rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; type=&quot;text/css&quot; href=&quot;main.css&quot;/&gt;\n     &lt;link rel=&quot;preconnect&quot; href=&quot;https://bit.ly&quot;/&gt;\n     &lt;link rel=&quot;preconnect&quot; href=&quot;https://port-80-ywfrg4rd7y.treehouse-app.com&quot;/&gt;\n  &lt;/head&gt;\n  &lt;body&gt;\n    &lt;form class=&quot;string_form&quot; width=&quot;720&quot; height=&quot;120&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;div class=&quot;span_container&quot;&gt;\n       &lt;span class=&quot;numbers_span&quot;&gt;\n         Please input a String&lt;br&gt;\n         into the text field Below.\n        &lt;/span&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n      &lt;div class=&quot;psuedo_input_outter&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;input name=&quot;InitialString&quot; type=&quot;text&quot;\n                 minlength=&quot;2&quot; maxlength=&quot;255&quot; value=&quot;&quot; required&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;fieldset name=&quot;StringOperator&quot;&gt;\n              &lt;label for=&quot;Option1_TransformUpperCase&quot;\n                     class=&quot;Numbers_label&quot;&gt;Transform To&lt;br&gt;Upper Case&lt;/label&gt;\n                &lt;input type=&quot;radio&quot; name=&quot;rad0&quot; value=&quot;UpperCase&quot;&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n              &lt;label for=&quot;Option2_TransformLowerCase&quot;\n                     class=&quot;Numbers_label&quot;&gt;Transform To&lt;br&gt;Lower Case&lt;/label&gt;\n                &lt;input type=&quot;radio&quot; name=&quot;rad1&quot; value=&quot;LowerCase&quot;&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n              &lt;label for=&quot;Option3_FirstCharUpperCase&quot;\n                     class=&quot;Numbers_label&quot;&gt;First Charater&lt;br&gt;Upper Case&lt;/label&gt;\n                &lt;input type=&quot;radio&quot; name=&quot;rad2&quot; value=&quot;FirstChar&quot;&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n              &lt;label for=&quot;Option4_AllWordsFirstUpperCase&quot;\n                     class=&quot;Numbers_label&quot;&gt;First Charater&lt;br&gt;All words Upper Case&lt;/label&gt;\n                &lt;input type=&quot;radio&quot; name=&quot;rad3&quot; value=&quot;AllFirstChar&quot;&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n            &lt;/fieldset&gt;\n          &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot; id=&quot;No_Submit&quot;\n                  name=&quot;Submit&quot; class=&quot;number_challenge_submit&quot;&gt;Submit&lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/form&gt;\n    &lt;?php\n      error_reporting(E_ALL);\n      session_start();\n\n      $_initialString;\n      $_outputString;\n// ::&gt;&gt; Notes:           !!&gt;&gt;&gt; Why does HTML attribute checked=&quot;true&quot; not move onto the new radio when a different one is selected?\n// ::&gt;&gt; Notes:\n      if(isset($_GET['Submit'])){\n        if(isset($_GET['InitialString'])){\n                 $_initialString = $_GET['InitialString'];\n           $ToUpperCase    = false;\n           $ToLowerCase    = false;\n           $FirstCharUpper = false;\n           $AllFirstUppper = false;\n           $stringOperator = isset($_GET['StringOperator']);\n          switch($stringOperator){\n            case &quot;rad0&quot;:  // Not sure these are correct check them on SO, w3school..\n               $ToUpperCase = true;\n               $newStr = strtoupper($_initialString);\n               echo &quot;&lt;span class='result'&gt;&quot; . $newStr . &quot;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;;\n            break;\n            case &quot;rad1&quot;:\n               $ToLowerCase = true;\n               $newStr = strtolower($_initialString);\n               echo &quot;&lt;span class='result'&gt;&quot; . $newStr . &quot;&lt;/span&gt;&quot;;\n            break;\n            case &quot;rad2&quot;:\n               $FirstCharUpper = true;\n            break;\n            case &quot;rad3&quot;:\n               $AllFirstUpper = true;\n               echo ucwords($_initialString);\n            break;\n          \n          }\n        // Need to create a check to see which radio button is set.\n        // Atleast one of the radio buttons needs to have the html attrib required\n        // Use javascript to move this attrib around, based on user select then add attrib \n                                                                 // disabled to all others\n          \n\n          // substr_replace($_initialString);\n          \n          // Need strtoupper();\n          // Need strtolower();\n          // Need ucwords();\n          // Need lcfirst();\n          \n          // Need to bind these to the radio buttons and use\n          //      javascript to disable any none selected radio's\n          \n        } // 2nd if();             \n      }   // 1st if();\n     ?&gt;\n  &lt;script src=&quot;/Js/numbersJs.js&quot; charset=&quot;utf-8&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n  &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>JS</p>\n<pre><code>console.log('numbers linked ok..');\ndocument.addEventListener(&quot;DOMContentLoaded&quot;,function(e){\n   let qSAll =(s)=&gt;{\n       return document.querySelectorAll(s);\n   }\n   \n   let radioBtns = qSAll('input[type=radio]');\n  \n   if(radioBtns){\n      // ::&gt;&gt; console.trace(radioBtns);\n      for(var i=0;i&lt;radioBtns.length;i++){\n          if(radioBtns[i].checked == true){\n             console.log(radioBtns[i].value);\n          }\n      }\n   }   \n   console.log(radioBtns);\n  \n   //if(radioBtns[0]){\n   // console.log('checked');\n   //}\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>CSS</p>\n<pre><code>.string_form{\n  overflow:hidden;\n  /* min-width:calc(748px + 2.2vw); */\n  /* max-height:calc(438px + 0.85vh); */\n  }\n.span_container{\n  background:linear-gradient(-33deg,#cdcecc,white,gold);\n  border-radius:4px;\n  user-select:none;\n  }\n.numbers_span{\n  font-size:calc(12.2px + 1.23vw + 0.234vh);\n  padding:1px 18px 1px 18px;\n  font-family:'Knights Templar', sans-serif;\n  border-radius:4px;\n  }\ninput[type=text]{\n  position:relative;\n  width:411px; max-width:411px;\n  transform:translateX(-52px);\n  padding:0 2px 0 2px;\n  border-radius:4.8px;\n  }\ninput[type=radio]{\n  position:relative;\n  margin-bottom:calc(28px + 0.08vh);\n  max-width:14px;max-height:14px;\n  transform:translateX(-174px) translateY(25.8px);\n  }\n.Numbers_label{\n  clear:both;\n  float:left;\n  background:linear-gradient(-33deg,rgba(242,213,162,0.7),gold);\n  padding:4px 9.2px 4px 9.2px;\n  font-family:'Knights Templar',sans-serif;\n  user-select:none;\n  border-radius:9px;\n  border-bottom-right-radius:2.1px;\n  margin-bottom:4px;\n  }\n.numbers_label::before{\n  display:block;\n  position:relative;\n  left:-42px;\n  width:25px; Please upload images only.', 400), false);\n  }\n};\n\nexports.uploadReviewPhoto = multer({\n  storage: multerS3({\n    s3: s3,\n    acl: 'public-read',\n    bucket: 'bucketname',\n    contentType: multerS3.AUTO_CONTENT_TYPE,\n    fileFilter: multerFilter,\n    transforms: () =&gt;\n      sharp().resize(250, 250).withMetadata().jpeg({\n        progressive: true,\n        quality: 90,\n      }),\n    key: function (req, file, cb) {\n      cb(null, 'reviewPhotos/' + Date.now().toString());\n    },\n  }),\n}).array('userPhotos', 10);\n</code></pre>\n<p>Not sure if helpful, but this is the front-end code that gets the information from the form:</p>\n<pre><code>if (reviewForm)\n  reviewForm.addEventListener('submit', (e) =&gt; {"body":"<p>I don’t want the menu to cover the input box.  My Vuetify version is 2.3.18. noreferrer\">https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/2377</a></p>\n<p>Vuetify <code>v-select</code> Codepen example:\n<a href=\"https://codepen.io/zmrqodfu/pen/abZeVOP?editors=101\" rel=\"nofollow class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>Vue.use(Vuetify);\n\nvar vm = new Vue({\n  el: \"#app\",\n  methods: {\n  },\n  data () {\n    return {\n      select: { state: 'Florida', abbr: 'FL' },\n      hideDetails: false,\n      items: [\n        { state: 'Florida', abbr: 'FL' },\n        { state: 'Georgia', abbr: 'GA' },\n        { state: 'Nebraska', abbr: 'NE' },\n        { state: 'California', abbr: 'CA' },\n        { state: 'New York', abbr: 'NY' }\n      ]\n    }\n  },\n});</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/vue/2.4.3/vue.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://unpkg.com/vuetify@0.14.8/dist/vuetify.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n\n&lt;link rel=stylesheet type=\"text/css\" href=\"https://unpkg.com/vuetify@0.14.8/dist/vuetify.min.css\"&gt;\n\n&lt;div id=\"app\"&gt;\n    &lt;v-app dark&gt;\n       &lt;v-select\n            v-bind:items=\"items\"\n            v-model=\"select\"\n            label=\"Select\"\n            single-line\n            :hide-details=\"hideDetails\"\n            hint=\"Hint of Select\"\n            item-text=\"state\"\n            item-value=\"abbr\"\n            return-object\n            autocomplete\n          &gt;&lt;/v-select&gt;\n    &lt;/v-app&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":528,"question_id":64971814,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have a functional <code>Item</code> component that uses <code>React.memo</code>. The component renders a few different input fields. I'm trying to update the state value for the changed <code>Item</code> but I am not sure how to do that without mutating or changing the current state since my original implementation caused <code>nextProps</code> and <code>prevProps</code> for <code>React.memo</code> to be the same.</p>\n<p>Here is my handler in the parent container component:</p>\n<pre><code>handleItemChange = (item, event, index) =&gt; {\n\n    item[event.target.name] = event.target.value;\n    this.setState({\n      job: this.state.job\n    })\n\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>My state looks something like this:</p>\n<pre><code>this.state = {\n    job: {\n        items: [{id: 1, quantity: 3, name: &quot;test&quot;}, {id: 2, quantity: 1, name: &quot;test 2&quot;}, {id: 3, quantity: 1, name: &quot;test 3&quot;}]\n    }\n} \n</code></pre>\n<p>In my form component, I render a list of <code>Items</code> like this:</p>\n<pre><code>{this.props.job.items.map((i, index) =&gt; (\n    &lt;Item key={i.id} handleItemChange={this.props.handleItemChange} item={i} index={index} /&gt;\n ))}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Then, in my <code>Item</code> component (that's memoized) I  render the input fields and call the handler:</p>\n<pre><code>function areEqual(prevProps, nextProps) {\n\n  console.log(prevProps.job_item.quantity)\n  console.log(nextProps.job_item.quantity)\n\n  return true\n};\n\nconst Item = React.memo(props =&gt; {\n\n  return (\n\n\n    &lt;Grid container spacing={3}&gt;\n      &lt;Grid item xs={1}&gt;\n          &lt;FormControl&gt;\n            &lt;TextField\n              name=&quot;quantity&quot;\n              value={props.item.quantity}\n              label=&quot;quantity&quot;\n              variant=&quot;outlined&quot;\n              type=&quot;number&quot;\n              onChange={e =&gt; props.handleItemChange(props.item, e, props.index)}\n              InputLabelProps={{\n                shrink: true,\n              }}\n            /&gt;\n          &lt;/FormControl&gt;\n        &lt;/Grid&gt;\n    &lt;/Grid&gt;\n\n\n\n  )\n\n}, areEqual);\n\nexport default Item;\n</code></pre>\n<p>With this current code, both prop objects in <code>areEqual</code> contain identical values and I believe this is because I am changing the <code>item</code> directly in the <code>handleItemChange</code> handler but I'm not sure how to change the item value without referencing it directly. I looked at making a deep copy of the array object, but I'm not sure how to do that. I am also passing the index value so referencing <code>this.state.job.items[index]</code> is possible for my case.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":529,"question_id":64971780,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
